data.name: Blonde Ale with Brettanomyces
data.description: This fruity, clean blonde ale gets an added kick thanks to the introduction of Brettanomyces Claussenii, which lends a faint hint of smoky citrus reminiscent of charred Meyer lemons before a bone dry finish.

style.name: Golden or Blonde Ale
style.description: Golden or Blonde ales are straw to golden blonde in color. They have a crisp, dry palate, light to medium body, and light malt sweetness. Low to medium hop aroma may be present but does not dominate. Bitterness is low to medium. Fruity esters may be perceived but do not predominate. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Penrose Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Art, Science, and Belgian-Inspired Brewing in Geneva, IL. 

This began with a shared obsession for skillfully brewed beer, and the starved need for cultural redirection of our lifework. Blissfully content with an opportunity to help refine a discerning palate, preferably with beer in hand, a deeper passion and commitment to the cause has evolved into Penrose Brewing Company. The cultural shift already underway is a by-product of intention and specificity. You will want to be involved.

data.name: Blonde Ambition
data.description:
All the passion and flavor you'd expect from a Great South Bay Blonde.

This blonde ale captures our lively spirit in a glass. It's bubbly, fruity and fresh, with a sassy ending. It's the perfect choice any time of the year, but favored at the beach, the boat or at your summer BBQ. Invigorating and inviting, this blonde will sweeten your appetite and leave you wanting more. We can't reveal all of her secret ingredients but you'll have fun discovering them all summer long!

breweries.name: Bravo! Restaurant and Cafe
breweries.description: Our Bravo! Handcrafted beer is made in-house by our award winning chefs. We are one of the only restaurants in Kalamazoo to brew their own beer. We brew beer in small batches using natural ingredients. We never use additives or extracts. Our slow fermentation and use of all grains create the natural malt flavors of high-quality beers. Our beers have refreshing and crisp flavors which our Chef's enjoy pairing with our menu offerings.

data.name: Blonde Bomber
data.description: With the Blonde Bomber American Blonde Ale, Eric created a beer that’s beautiful to look at in a clear glass.  Its blonde coloration (SRM 3-5) and satisfying mouth feel are backed by a light hop aroma and a medium dry to somewhat sweet taste depending on the food accompaniment.  Like The Veteran, The Blonde Bomber is an easy-to-drink session beer with 5.0% alcohol by volume, a true craft beer created for drinkers that love a beer with a gentle flavor profile and a pleasing texture.  Its small, primrose-colored bubbles communicate the true nature of the beer both in the glass and on the palate.

The company will produce, sell, and deliver beers of superior quality, striving to employ Veterans in every role within the organization and the supply chain while adhering to the highest principles of military service, conducting business with integrity, courage, and loyalty.

breweries.name: The Old Cannon Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a privately owned, genuinely independent free house in Bury and certainly the only brew pub in Suffolk where you can actually see beer in the making on a regular basis. Beers are made on the premises using East Anglian grown and ma

The Brewery does not specifically cater for young children and under 14s are not allowed in the bar at any time - however, at the manager's discretion, family groups are welcome to lunch together on Saturdays and Sundays.

Dogs are always welcome in the beer garden but only in the bar on a Sunday evening.

The Old Cannon, including the Brewery Rooms, is smoke-free. We have a designated smoking area with a heated umbrella in the beer garden.

breweries.name: Hamburger Mary's

Mary's expanded in 2009 and added a small brewery, making her the oldest nano-brewery in Chicago.  Mary's motto is "an open-air bar & grill for open-minded people,"  where all are welcome to "Eat, Drink.. .and be MARY!"

breweries.name: Apocalypse Ale Works
breweries.description: Apocalypse Ale Works is the first brewery in Forest, Virginia since Thomas Jefferson brewed in the 1800's at Poplar Forest. In addition to a brewery, we also have a tasting room, where the public can try our products. We are located in the old Forest Volunteer Fire Department, beside Pints O'Plenty. The brewery will sell kegs all over the state of Virginia, with an emphasis on supplying the local restaurants first. Eventually we will expand to bottling our beer. Our mission is to brew quality beer for all palates. The end of bad beer is here!

data.name: Blonde Bombshell
data.description: As the name implies, this is one knock-out of a beer.  Brewed to be a light bodied, refreshing ale, Blonde Bombshell combines subtle malt and wheat flavors with a delicate Liberty hop aroma to create a sensational beer.  Originally brewed as a seasonal, this beer was so popular it pushed its way into our regular line-up.

breweries.name: Cascade Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Cascade Lakes Brewing Company was founded in 1994 by three enthusiastic brothers looking for an exciting business in beautiful, sunny Central Oregon.  They spent many long nights building brewing equipment by hand and coming up with tasty recipes.  More than twenty years later, the long nights and quest for great beer has continued, but on a much larger scale.

In the winter of 2000, Cascade Lakes Brewing Company was purchased by Rick Orazetti and Doug Kutella.  Ron Kutella and Chris Justema soon joined the partnership. What started as a small brewing facility in an airport industrial zone has turned into a state-of-the-art, 25-barrel brew house system that allows brewing 775 gallons per batch, three times daily. The partners also expanded from just a brewery to having four local pubs: 7th Street Brew House, Tumalo Tavern, Cascade West Grub and Alehouse, and our flagship restaurant in Bend, Cascade Lakes Lodge. Cascade Lakes beer is now distributed and sold in Washington, Oregon, and Idaho.

Cascade Lakes brews six beers year-round: Blonde Bombshell, 20” Brown, Paddleboard Porter, Hopsmack IPA, Mosaic IPA, and Cyclops IPA. They brew many seasonals throughout the year including: Snow Park XPA, Slippery Slope, Skookum Creek Ale, Paulina Lake Pilsner, Waste Deep Weiss, Riverside Red, Silverback Imperial Stout, Kolsch, IRA, etc. Look for our beers on draft at your favorite pub and grab a six-pack at your local grocery store.

PHIL BREY – HEAD BREWER
Phil brings 25 years of winemaking and brewing experience to Cascade Lakes Brewing Co. Phil started home brewing in college while working on his degree in Enology (winemaking) at Fresno State. Phil started with some winemaking stints in California at Mirassou Winery and Bogle Vineyards before moving to Bend. He began his professional brewing career at Deschutes Brewery. After some time over in the valley making wine at Benton-Lane Winery and Spindrift Cellars, and brewing at Oregon Trail Brewery, Phil returned to the High Desert to brew at Cascade Lakes, where he has worked since 2010. When Phil isn’t producing some sort of alcohol, he can be found mountain biking, hiking, gardening and spending time with family.

data.description: Light golden color from use of American grown pale malted barley, MA grown corn and wheat. Slightly sweet malt aroma continues into the flavor. Balanced by light hop bitterness and flavor. Finishes slightly dry. An easy drinking Blonde Ale perfect for the summer.

data.name: Blonde Horizon
data.description: Boatyard Brewing Company’s Blonde Horizon was the first ale created at our research and development facility. This blond is made with a great combination of pale ale and crystal malts which produce a smooth caramel backbone. Then we blend in a little rye just to spice her up. The Palisades hops and traditional Irish ale yeast create one of the most drinkable ales you will ever meet. This blonde is great all year round, but shines on a hot summer afternoon!

data.name: Blonde Hunny Ale
data.description: An unfiltered Belgian style Blonde Ale with wheat and a lot of local honey in every pour.  We have also added a special spice blend to give it an added kick.  Smooth and refreshing, but be careful – this one’s ABV will sneak up on you.  This beer is straw yellow in color with a slight sweetness in the middle and an estery finish characteristic of the best Belgian beers.

data.name: Blonde Premium Beer
data.description: Isle of Arran Blonde Premium Beer is a product of its place: an island where nature still holds sway, where tradition is still valued. Arran blonde combines substance with zest, significance with freshness. A truly fine beer brewed from only the purest water and natural ingredients, and free of artificial additives or preservatives. Naturally.

breweries.name: Isle of Arran Brewery
breweries.description: Situated just off the West coast of Scotland the Isle of Arran is arguably one of the most beautiful and dramatic islands in Europe. The splendor and diversity of the landscape has led it to be considered by many as Scotland in miniature. Nestled between the islands largest mountain, Goatfell and the imposing Brodick Castle lies Arran Brewery which has been brewing award winning craft beer for over a decade.

data.name: Blonde Rock
data.description: A blonde ale derived from a blend of Canadian 2 row barley wheat and Munich malt. A light but mellow malty character giving way to the aromatic flavor of cascade hops on the finish. Great with food or on its own is what makes this beer our most popular.

breweries.name: Rudder's Seafood Restaurant & Brew Pub
breweries.description:
Good times, great food and hand-crafted ales are served up daily at Rudder's Seafood Restaurant  & Brew Pub.  Soak up the ambiance as you dine on fresh seafood and sip premium brewed beers, brewed on-site at South West Nova’s only microbrewery restaurant. 

Just a five-minute walk from downtown, this business is famous for its delicious seafood, excellent service and spacious wrap-around deck overlooking Yarmouth's waterfront.  The 18th- century beamed ceilings and thick plank floors of Rudder’s Seafood Restaurant are part of the draw for thousands of locals and tourists annually. 

Live entertainment can be enjoyed most nights of the week. A 12-slip floating dock marina is located on the property for the convenience of nautical guests. Rudders also offers customized private banquets and meeting facilities.

Recognized as the social hub of the waterfront, this landmark is a lively place year-round.   Expect smiles, attentive service and the occasional song from Rudder's carefully selected staff.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

breweries.name: High Water Brewing
breweries.description:
Leveraging his successful 15 year brewing career, Brewmaster Steve Altimari is proud to enter his fifth year at the helm of High Water Brewing. "High Water" being a playful interpretation of Steve's last name. A loose Italian translation of "Alta" meaning High and "Mare" meaning Seas or Water led us to the High Water name.

Inspired by the most creative brewing practices and styles across the world, Steve's love of beer and unbridled passion for all things flavorful have led to a line of products that represent the very best of the best. Steve's vision of creating unique and flavorful beers and getting them into a glass have taken fruition.

High Water Brewing is partnered with Hermitage Brewing in San Jose to allow growth of our production capacity to meet our growing customer demand.

High Water Brewing is now licensed as a small beer manufacturer at the E.J.Phair Pittsburg brewery. We have installed 2 of our 30 bbl fermenters and are producing a new line of draft beers. These are one off recipes and released as the High Water Tributary Series.

 High Water Beers are now distributed in Northern, Central and Southern California, Reno, Las Vegas, Seattle, New York, Vermont, Florida, Japan, Taipei, Brazil, Denmark, Sweden, Rome, London and Amsterdam.

Keep an eye out for High Water products at a craft beer location near you!

breweries.name: Aarhus Bryghus
breweries.description:
Aarhus Brewery makes special beer for enjoyment! That is to say that art is not so advanced as to result in afskræmmende and can only be drunk by connoisseurs. Anyone who wants to try something new, you will find joy in Aarhus Brewery products.

Aarhus Brewery makes special beer with between 5 and 9% alcohol, bottled in large 60 cl bottles. There will be a beer which will be suitable as an aperitif beer, which beer will be suitable for fish and meat dishes light, and there will be dark, heavy and bulky beers, which are suitable for meats and cheeses.

It builds both fixed beers and varying seasonal beers. Read more in products.

The brewery is purely a production brewery that produces beer and brave this in bottles and kegs. There is not affiliated catering to the brewery. On the other hand we do tours for small groups of between 15 and 75 people.

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

breweries.name: Fenton Winery & Brewery
breweries.description: The Fenton Winery & Brewery is located on a beautiful, 5 acre property in Fenton Township. At over 1 acre, the beer garden is one (if not the) largest in the state. The taproom is located right alongside the brewery and is around the corner from the winery - all in full view of patrons. FWB specializes in crafting balanced wines and beers that maximize flavor and originality. Food is available - from tasty specialty meat & cheese plates, to delicious sandwiches and specialty pizzas. Definitely worth a stop (or three). Cheers!

data.name: Blue Collar Blonde
data.description: At the end of a long work day you deserve to take off your gloves, pry off your boots and enjoy a little refreshment. Our crisp, Blonde Ale has been brewed to deliver both the drinkability you desire and the flavor you crave. So kick back, pop a top and enjoy the only blonde that will never turn you down!

breweries.name: Rusty Rail Brewing Company
breweries.description:
If our building could talk it would speak of rugged workers who got by on the determination in their hearts, the strength of their backs and the dirt on their hands. We proudly dedicate every ounce of our beer to those whose efforts have forged the American work ethic. So grab a cold one and pay tribute to the past by making the most of the present.

Our team of passionate craft beer enthusiasts firmly believes in making great beer that is fun and approachable. We know that putting a smile on your face is just as important as putting a beer in your hand, and we plan on taking over the world one state and one craft beer drinker at a time.

breweries.name: Blue Spruce Brewing
breweries.description:
Brewer, Rick Kane has been brewing beer since the early 90's. After brewing so long he decided to go to school and get a degree in Beer Engineering, which fit perfectly with his science teaching credential. His plan is to have 8-12 beers on tap, along with a couple of local guest taps. 
The restaurant will feature taco shop mexican food. There will be appetizers that pair perfectly with beer, along with some sandwich and salad options. 
We know that Highlands Ranch and Centennial have been waiting for a local brewery to call their own. Hold on tight, here we come!

breweries.name: Lonerider Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We opened our doors on January 23rd, 2009 and since then we have been impressed with the enthusiasm of craft beer aficionados we meet daily. The craft brewing industry is booming and you can find a tremendous variety out there. North Carolina has undoubtedly become the Southern State for beer with Asheville reigning supreme and Raleigh/Durham/CH not far behind. We hope you continue to support the variety and encourage new brewers to experiment with and craft new styles for everybody’s pleasure.

"Effect change; don't be an audience. Walk your own path, and instead of thinking outside the box, imagine if there was no box."

data.name: Blueberry Blonde
data.description: When do blondes have more fun? When they go blue! We brewed this light, creamy-blue ale with gobs of blueberries from the Blueberry Patch in Sawyer, MI. It’s not at all sweet, and the blueberry aroma grows more pronounced as the beer warms and opens up. A little fruit-tart, citrusy, and biscuity, it’s southwest Michigan summertime in a glass!

breweries.name: Pleasant House Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Pleasant House Brewing Company is an independently owned microbrewery focusing on small-batch, true-to-style beers, especially traditional UK styles.

The original Pleasant House is an 1800s cottage that still looks out on the rolling green hills of rural Yorkshire, England. In the 1950s and ’60s, the Jackson family called Pleasant House home. Today, it is the inspiration behind husband and wife team Art and Chelsea Jackson’s Pleasant House restaurants and microbrewery. Our beers pair brilliantly with our award-winning, savory Royal Pies and other British-inspired, locally sourced specialties.

All of our microbrews are crafted on the premises in our historic 1887 building in Three Oaks, Michigan.

breweries.name: Big Muddy Brewing Co
breweries.description:
All over the United States, craft breweries are continuing an American tradition which experienced an almost 50 year drought after the repeal of prohibition. Big Muddy Brewing in Murphysboro, Illinois is much like many of these new “microbreweries” all over the country, reinvigorating an industry and continuing a heritage that has skipped several generations.
Until 1940, Murphysboro was the home of a thriving brewery and until prohibition; it was one of the cornerstones of the town’s industry. In 1910, the Stecher Brewing Company produced more than 40,000 barrels of beer a year. However, passage of the Volstead Act in 1919, which ushered in the era of prohibition, began a slow decline to the brewery’s demise.
Big Muddy Brewing’s founder Chuck Stuhrenberg attended Southern Illinois University Carbondale in the 1980s. After graduation, he opened a franchise of Chicago’s Rosati’s Pizza in Carbondale and in 1990, began another venture, Spray Shield Industries.
It was while Stuhrenberg was in college at SIU that he began making his own beer.
Stuhrenberg and his college buddies would homebrew, and as the years went on, he began to take his hobby more seriously.
Stuhrenberg always had professional brewing in the back of his mind, but it stayed a hobby until 2009. In July, 2009, Big Muddy Brewing finally began production, the first brewery in Murphysboro in over 50 years.
The first beer offered by Big Muddy Brewing is Kinkaid Wheat. It was a recipe popular with Stuhrenberg’s family and friends. It was also something he felt would be a good “craft beer transition brew” for those used to the conventional corporate brew (BMC).
Kinkaid Wheat is currently offered on tap and by bottle in bars, restaurants and liquor stores across Southern Illinois alongside of Big Muddy Brewing’s second selection, “Saluki Dunkel Dog”, a dark, amber/dunkel style beer.
The third and newest addition to Big Muddy Brewing’s lineup is an ale called “Big Muddy Pale Ale”, and future varieties include “Logan’s Lager”.

data.name: Blues' Golden Ale
data.description: A mellow, yet refreshing golden ale with balanced layers of flavor. The crisp and clean finish of the Golden Ale makes it the perfect complement to any meal. Available in bottles, kegs and growlers.

breweries.name: 16 Mile Brewing Company
breweries.description:
16 Mile Brewing Company, Inc. opened its doors in July 2009 to the public. It is owned and operated by Brett McCrea and Chad Campbell.

The 16 Mile Brewing Company name harkens back to the late 1700’s when Georgetown was still known as Pettijohn’s old field, a rather isolated town, centrally located in Sussex County. The area was “16 miles from anywhere” in the county and was the best place for farmers, merchants, and politicians to meet to conduct official business. Georgetown replaced Lewes as the County Seat when numerous petitions were sent to Delaware’s General Assembly requesting that the move be made to accommodate all county residents. (For more information see “16 Miles from Anywhere: A History of Georgetown, Del., by William J. Wade.)

breweries.name: Backshore Brewing Company
breweries.description: There's something about the beach that feeds your soul, keeps you young, and demands your return. Of the millions who visit, a few are distracted by romantic visions of life at the beach and are left behind, never to return to the "real world." It's an existence unaffected by time or authority. Days and nights blend together, signaled by sunrises over the ocean and sunsets in the bay. Their hearts become gorged with rebellion and pride, inherent in all Americans but enjoyed by few. It is with the same celebration of freedom and togetherness that we have conceived this beer. We brew our beer in the salty air with our toes in the sand and the sun on our faces. Lucky for you, we can't finish it all. Please have as much fun drinking Backshore Beer as we have making it. We've spent serious time creating it. Have a ridiculous time enjoying it.

breweries.name: Brewzzi Boca Raton
breweries.description: Brewzzi is famous for its enormous portions of quality Italian and American favorites. Enjoy brick oven pizza, pasta, oversized salads, trademark sandwiches, Angus hamburgers, fresh fish and more. With over 70 items on the menu, there's something to please every palate. Even the kids, who eat free every Monday and Tuesday... And don't forget the brewery! Brewzzi's brewed-on-site lagers and ales have won gold and silver medals at the Great American Beer Festival. And of course they're half-price, along with featured Premium brands, during the Brewzzi Happy Hour, Monday-Friday from 3pm-6:30pm and ALL DAY Sunday.

data.name: Bollywood Blonde
data.description:
Gorgeous copper-orange ale with a rich, enticing aroma of oranges and lemongrass. Crisp and refreshing on the palate. A perfect blend of malt, spice, and sweet and zesty hints of citrus.
Nestled between beer-loving Germany and wine-loving France, for centuries Belgium has produced some of the most interesting, complex, sophisticated, and delicious styles the beer world has to offer. The Blonde pays homage to this grand tradition. Brewed with a unique blend of rich malts, sweet orange peel, spicy hops, and zesty coriander for a delicious brew that straddles the line between beer, cider, and wine.
data.foodPairings: The fruity character and extremely low bitterness of the Blonde make it a perfect pairing for spicy dishes like curries, Jamaican jerk, spicy barbecue, Tex-Mex, as well as pastries or breads made with fruits or nuts.

breweries.name: Arbor Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our love affair with beer began in 1991 with our first batch of homebrew. Eventually the brewing operation took over the kitchen and basement and we decided it was time to look for larger digs. So with the help of family and friends, we opened the ABC Brewpub a brewery and restaurant in Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1995.

data.name: Bombardier Burning Gold
data.description: Bombardier Burning Gold is one of two sister beers of Wells Bombardier. Inspired by the words of William Blake’s ‘Jerusalem’, Wells Bombardier Burning Gold is a tribute to all that is celebrated in English beer. Brewed with the same passion for excellence as the original, Burning Gold is a refreshing golden beer which is enjoyed by ale and lager drinkers.

Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.

From the ice rink to the brewery, Bomber Brewing is the shared dream of three friends with a passion for playing hockey and savouring good beer.   We drafted a team, combined our skills, and in February of 2014, we launched one of the newest micro-breweries to hit the Vancouver scene.

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

data.name: Bombshell Blonde
data.description: Brewed with American Pale and Vienna malt that combine to give this ale its distinctive smooth, creamy body. Just enough hops are added to this rich, golden colored ale to perfectly balance its bready finish. Fermented at a cool temperature to give a clean finish.

breweries.name: Southern Star Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in Conroe, Texas, Southern Star Brewing Company will provide Texans(and others) new craft beers to enjoy from our 10,000 square foot warehouse. 

Production began in March of 2008 with our signature beer of Pine Belt Pale Ale which is in our distinctive 16oz can or in kegs. This has now expanded to include Bombshell Blonde(12oz cans) and Buried Hatchet Stout(12oz cans), but both are also kegged. These will just be a few of the ales we will be offering as we expand into seasonal batches, plus we just started our PRO-AM line of brews where home brewers can compete to have their recipe produced at our brewery(with the help of the creators if they desire). The winning entry will also be entered into the GABF. 

Thanks to the help of our five distributors, we are able to get our brews to a variety of locations(including grocery stores, beverage shops, pubs and restaurants) throughout Texas and a few other states including Alabama, Florida, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and South Carolina. Unfortunately due to laws in Texas we can't tell you where you can buy our beers, but we are working at trying to get them to as many of your favorite craft beer establishments as possible.

data.name: Bombshell Blonde Ale
data.description:
OK, the jokes were too easy when it came to naming this one - so we took it easy on all of the blondes out there. The Bombshell is golden in color, light in body and very refreshing.

Feel free to add your own blonde joke. At your own risk.
